page.title: 11Communications: Television
page.content: {Communications} can be between individual people or for the masses. {Television} is normally used for the mass comunication of information, ideas, advertising and entertainment. Most homes will have a {television set} which displays moving coloured pictures from anywhere in the world. A special {camera} takes the pictures which are then recorded, or transmitted live to any {T.V. receiver.} The television can be very large, mounted on the wall of a hall, or small enough to be carried around. The coloured pictures are made up of over a million dots of three colours which blend together to form the final picture. {Closed circuit television} can be used in shops to spot thieves, or for private educational and training programmes.
